meanings.definition: The act of beating or striking with force.
meanings.sent1: The waling of the drum echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: He heard the waling of the hammer against the metal.
meanings.sent3: The waling of the wind against the windows made a spooky sound.
meanings.sent4: The waling of the waves against the shore was a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The waling of the thunder in the distance signaled an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: A horizontal timber or rod used in construction for support or reinforcement.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter placed the waling along the edge of the structure.
meanings.sent2: The waling provided additional strength to the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the waling as a balance beam.
meanings.sent4: The waling stood firm like a guardian protecting the construction site.
meanings.sent5: The waling supported the weight of the roof, keeping everything in place.
